document_data.name: Crocodile
document_data.terrain: Rivers, Salt marshes, Swamps, Urban areas
document_data.mainbody: '''Crocodiles''' were a large carnivorous [[reptile]] that resided in swamps, rivers, lakes, and other wetlands.
document_data.Biology:
Being reptiles, crocodiles were quite vulnerable to cold, becoming slow and sluggish if exposed to it.

Their four legs, though short, were noted as being quite powerful in terms of propelling them rapidly through their watery habitats.

Crocodiles mated once every year, laying clutches of up to 60 eggs that they then buried beneath sand. Unlike some reptiles, a female crocodile was known to carefully guard her clutch of eggs against any potential predators. When the eggs eventually hatched the mother would assist her young in getting free of the sand, but thereafter would leave them to fend for themselves. As a result, typically very few hatchlings would manage to survive to maturity.
document_data.History: In [[1357 DR]], crocodiles could occasionally be found in the sewers beneath [[Waterdeep]].
document_data.Sub-Species:
* Black caiman, a variety of crocodile that lived beneath the waters of the [[Serpent's Tail Stream]] in [[Najara]].
* [[Giant crocodile]], a monstrous variety of the standard crocodile. They were more commonly found in salt water habitats.
* [[Feymire crocodile]], a variety of crocodile that was endemic to the marshes of the [[Feywild]].
document_data.Rumors & Legends: There were rumors that somehow crocodiles had made their way into the sewers of cities in tropical regions and were living off the urban environments' various waste and carrion.

Ecology.Habitats:
They were often encountered in the rivers of [[Chult]].

On the [[Malatran Plateau]], there was a large population of crocodiles in [[Sleepy Lake]].{{Cite polyhedron/113/Raft Dwellers: The Zantiri Tribe|6-7}} In the [[Crowded Sea]] region, they could be found on the island of [[Djinni's Claws]].
Ecology.Relationships: [[Ragarran priest]]s were often aided by both mundane and giant crocodiles.
Ecology.Usages: On the Malatran Plateau, the [[Zantira]] tribe of [[Nubari]] were known to hunt the crocodiles of Sleepy Lake with [[knife|knives]]. Male members of the tribe often fashioned necklaces made from their teeth.
